publications.name: Towards quantifying human experience in the built environment: A crowdsourcing based experiment to identify influential architectural design features
publications.summary: This project investigates the impact of architectural design features on human experience using crowdsourced data. It identifies key design elements that significantly influence aspects such as restorativeness, stress and anxiety, aesthetics, and motivation. The findings provide a framework for objectively quantifying how design features affect human experiences in various spaces, offering practical insights for architects and designers to enhance built environments.

publications.name: Proactive 2D model-based scan planning for existing buildings
publications.summary: We proposes a framework for optimizing scan planning using 2D models to improve the efficiency and accuracy of data collection for building information models (BIM). The framework integrates three search algorithms to generate initial scan plans and refine them, demonstrating that a combination of greedy search with backtracking and simulated annealing algorithms effectively enhances the scanning process, reducing the need for site revisits and improving overall data quality.
